thread.title: Man charged with trespass after walking on jet way at Newark airport
thread.title_full: Man charged with trespass after walking on jet way at Newark airport - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Associated Press
title: Man charged with trespass after walking on jet way at Newark airport
text:
NEWARK, N.J. - Police ticketed a man with trespassing after they say he walked onto a jet way where an unoccupied plane was parked at New Jersey's Newark Liberty International Airport.
Port Authority Police spokesman Joe Pentangelo says it happened around 8:30 p.m. Wednesday at United Airlines Gate 74 in Terminal C.
Pentangelo says 30-year-old Michael DeMarco of West Springfield, Massachusetts, passed through an alarmed door and walked onto the jet way.
Police say DeMarco said he had been drinking.
Pentangelo says DeMarco was a ticketed passenger who had arrived on a flight from Hartford, Connecticut, around 2 p.m. and missed his connection to Fort Lauderdale, Florida, which left at 8 p.m.
DeMarco was released early Thursday. It's not known if he continued on to Florida.
The aircraft was checked and deemed safe.
